articleContent.title: Chord: Major 7th in G# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
### Brief Presentation
The major 7th chord in the key of G# is often played in the A shape. It consists of the notes G#, B#, D#, and F##. This chord has a bright and somewhat jazzy sound that can add a sense of sophistication to your music.

### Notes and Intervals
- G# (Root)
- B# (Major 3rd)
- D# (Perfect 5th)
- F## (Major 7th)

### Genre and Musical Flavor
The major 7th chord in G# is commonly found in jazz, R&B, and soul music. It adds a lush and dreamy quality to compositions, often evoking feelings of nostalgia or romance. Its colorful, slightly dissonant sound can create tension and release in a musical piece.

### Songs
1. **"Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra** - This classic jazz standard features the major 7th chord prominently, adding a touch of elegance to the song.
   
2. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones** - The major 7th chord in G# can be heard in the smooth chords of this popular jazz-pop ballad, enhancing its laid-back vibe.
   
3. **"Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder** - In this funky R&B hit, the major 7th chord in G# contributes to the song's soulful and groovy atmosphere.
